quiz.question: Which symptom best describes 'dyspnea' as used by clinicians?
Which organ-specific tumor marker is commonly raised in prostate cancer screening?
Which enzyme deficiency underlies classic McArdle disease causing exercise intolerance?
Which infection is most commonly associated with Staphylococcus aureus?
Which condition involves demyelination in the central nervous system affecting young adults?
Which cancer staging system uses T, N, and M categories to describe extent of disease?
What condition is indicated by 'hyperglycemia' in laboratory results?
Which pathogen causes tuberculosis as detected by acid-fast bacilli staining?
Which electrophysiological finding defines atrial fibrillation on electrocardiogram?
options: Prolonged PR interval with dropped beats
Irregularly irregular rhythm without distinct P waves
Regular tachycardia with sawtooth P waves
quiz.answer: Irregularly irregular rhythm without distinct P waves

quiz.question: What does 'CBC' stand for in routine blood testing?
Which diagnostic marker indicates myocardial injury when elevated in blood tests?
Which screening criterion defines metabolic syndrome through waist, lipids, blood pressure, glucose abnormalities?
What does 'BMI' measure as a common clinical indicator?
Which antimicrobial mechanism do macrolides primarily use to inhibit bacteria?
Which clinical triad classically suggests normal pressure hydrocephalus in older adults?
options: Gait disturbance, urinary incontinence, cognitive decline
quiz.answer: Gait disturbance, urinary incontinence, cognitive decline
